page.title: 18 TRANSPORT IN ROCK FERRY
page.content: The area is well served by old and new {transport}routes. The Old Chester Road - a famous{coaching {route,}the New Chester Road and the Rock Ferry By-pass. These parallel routes have each in their turn come closer to the River Mersey. The Chester to Birkenhead Woodside railway line passed through Rock Ferry before its closure . The line terminates at Rock Ferry where passengers alight and board the {underground trains}for Liverpool. Electrification of the line from Rock Ferry to Chester is taking place. There is a large bus depot serving the Crosville Motor Company and by buses from the Merseyside Passenger Transport Executive (M.P.T.E.). These buses are green and cream in colour and have replaced the blue Birkenhead Corporation buses.
